org.gearvrf

Class GVREventReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVREventReceiver

  • public class GVREventReceiver
extends java.lang.Object
    An event receiver can contain a list of listeners, and deliver events to them upon request. It can be added as a field of any event receiving object, and handle events for them. To ensure all events can be received by scripts as well as listeners, this class doesn't provide an API to directly deliver events to the listeners. Instead, events should be delivered via the GVREventManager. Usage of this GVREventReceiver is the following:
    1. Add interface IEventReceiver to a class which need use listeners to handle events. Without listeners, it can only receive events from GVREventManager by directly implementing a subclass of interface IEvents.
    2. Add a field containing a GVREventReceiver object.
    3. Implement the method IEventReceiver.getEventReceiver() to return this GVREventReceiver object.
    After implementing the above pattern, GVREventManager.sendEvent(Object, Class, String, Object...) can be used to deliver events to the class. Note that a target object can only have one listener for each event class. Subsequent listeners for the same target and class are ignored.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener(IEvents listener)
        Adds a listener to the receiver. The listener can be a subclass of IEvents, such as IScriptEvents, ISensorEvents and so on.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be added.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(IEvents listener)
        Removes a listener from the receiver.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be removed.

      • getListeners

        protected java.util.List<IEvents> getListeners()
        Gets all listeners. Don't use this method directly to deliver events to the listeners. Instead, use GVREventManager to deliver an event to the owner of this GVREventReceiver.

      • getOwner

        protected IEventReceiver getOwner()
        Gets the owner of the event receiver.
        Returns:
        The owner of the event receiver.
